alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 31 at 4:14AM MDT until March 31 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS AS WELL AS THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Widespread critical fire weather conditions are expected late this morning through early evening from the northeast and central highlands to the Oklahoma and Texas borders. The strongest winds are likely during the early afternoon hours. Even though readings will be cooler today compared to Thursday, minimum humidities are expected to drop into the 8-15 percent range. Saturday will be a quieter day for much of New Mexico. The exception will be across the northeast plains where single digit humidities should combine with gusty winds, although not as strong as today. There could be a risk for critical fire weather conditions over the east central plains, but confidence in coverage and duration is still unclear. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Central Highlands (Zone 125) and East Central Plains (Zone 126) from 11 AM to 8 PM today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts near 65 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values dropping to between 10 and 15 percent this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
